campaign.story:
Hi! I'm Felice Regina (@iamlunasol on Instagram  & Twitter), an illustrator and pin designer! I've run many successful Kickstarter campaigns for enamel pins, but this will be my first time producing a zine!
Pledging will not only ensure that the zines get produced, but it will score you any freebies that we may unlock.
Cats in Japan is a illustrated zine based on my recent trip to Japan.
The zine will be 8" x 8", soft cover, saddle stitched, and include 18 full-color illustrations. Both the cover and interior pages will have a matte finish.
Signed Copies
Backers who pledge during the first 24 hours of the campaign can select the Signed Zine tier to have their copy of Cats in Japan signed by me!
Pledge now Risk-Free and Pay later! You can always increase/decrease or even cancel your pledge at any time during the Kickstarter. You will only be charged when the Kickstarter campaigns ends, provided we reach the initial $500 base goal. If we don't reach this base goal by the end of the the campaign date you will not be charged.
Stretch goals are available for all backers who pledge for one zine or higher tiers. Any unlocked stretch goals will be included with your zine at no extra charge.
$1000 - Postcard - UNLOCKED!
$2000 - Keychain - UNLOCKED!
$3000 - Enamel pin - UNLOCKED!
 $5000 - 4 New Pages of Illustrations - UNLOCKED!
 $6000 - Vinyl Sticker - UNLOCKED!
January 19 - Kickstarter Launches
February 9 - Kickstarter Ends + surveys sent out
Mid-February - Production order placed
April - Items arrive & I begin shipping
Zines will be packages in a sealed poly bag with a cardboard backer to prevent bending. Rewards will be shipped in bubble mailers.
All packages within the United States will be shipped via USPS First Class Mail. This service includes a tracking number at no extra cost! 
For international backers:
Please note I do not ship to Russia or Commonwealth of Independent States countries (Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Moldova, Russia, Russian Federation, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Ukraine, and Uzbekistan) due to lack of complete shipping insurance coverage and high rate of package loss in these countries.  Pledges with shipping addresses in these countries will be refunded and you will receive no rewards.
International parcels are shipped using a Global Advantage Program. Tracking for this postage method varies by country. Most commonly, tracking ceases once the package is in  possession of your country's postal system, but sometimes tracking continues to delivery. All international packages are fully insured. If you feel more comfortable and would like to upgrade your shipping method to add full tracking to your pledge that is totally possible! Please message me and I will tell you how much to add to your pledge in order to add tracking. Please understand that International backers are responsible for any customs fees their country may ask for, so be sure to plan accordingly!
Note: Backers are responsible for all taxes and fees associated with their packages. Packages will be marked as merchandise and the pledge value will be declared accurately. Requests to mark packages as "gifts" or with a lower declared value will be ignored.
Online Store
Instagram
Patreon & Monthly Pin Club
Twitter

updates.update_content: Pins have arrived! I'm getting right to work packing up rewards and they'll start shipping out tomorrow! It will probably take me a few days to get them all out. You'll get a shipping notification email with your tracking number. :D

The pins were supposed to arrive today buuuuut....they did not. It would appear that Fedex is experiencing shipping delays due to the COVID-19 situation, so it will be a few more days before the pins arrive and I can begin shipping. I'll be sure to keep y'all updated.

updates.update_userinfo: Pins are on the way! Rewards shipping soon!
updates.update_content:
I just got notice that the pins should be arriving on Monday, so if all goes well, I should be able to start shipping out rewards next week. 
I've initiated the process to disallow address changes, so you have 48 hours remaining if you need to update your shipping address. 
In other news, I have a lot of preorders for new pin and keychain designs on my store! Hope you like them. OwO

Hello, frens!
As of today, the zines, postcards, and stickers have been delivered to me and they all look great! 
Both my keychain and pin manufacturers were able to reopen in late February and I put in the production orders then. I'm expecting production on the pins and keychains to take a bit longer than usual though. Rewards will most likely be shipped in early April, which is still on schedule.

Thank you so much to everyone for a wonderful campaign! Reward surveys were sent out yesterday. 
You will be able to edit your shipping address until the items have arrived and are ready to ship. At that time you will receive a 48 hour warning to finalize your address before addresses are locked and no longer editable.
Some additional reminders:

The majority of comments on my last update / Instagram requested the next stretch goal be more pages for the zine, so that's what we're going with for the $5000 stretch goal, which is already unlocked!

We've hit $3000 which means all backers will now get the keychain and enamel pin for free with their pledges!
I want to add another stretch goal. Which would you rather have: more free postcards or more pages with new illustrations?! Let me know in the comments!

campaign.story:
Nine years in the making. Over 200 images of NASA's most iconic objects, as you’ve never seen them before. One man’s lifetime obsession with space exploration and the achievements of NASA. 
This is 'NASA - Past and Present Dreams of the Future', a new book to accompany the educational, experiential exhibition from photographer Benedict Redgrove, launching on the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 Moon landing. 
With unprecedented access to NASA’s spacecraft, labs and facilities Redgrove has created a unique and powerful tribute to the pioneers of space exploration. 


"...it is some of the most incredible imagery you'll ever find of the NASA space program. "
ACQUIRE MAGAZINE
“Benedict has created something that will forever be referred back to when people look at the history of space exploration.”
SIMON PHILLIPSON - AUTHOR OF APOLLO VII - XVII

“Benedict’s NASA images are some of the most awe inspiring, finely produced images I’ve had the pleasure of working with. The file quality, the lighting and attention to detail is second to none. You can feel his deep passion for NASA and Space come through in every shot - a true labour of love.”
ANDREW DIPROSE - CREATIVE DIRECTOR WIRED (UK)

“The culmination of nine years documenting the many aspects of the US space programme, Benedict Redgrove’s NASA project is shot in his distinctive style, with an almost scientific rigour that befits the subject matter. This body of work gives a fascinating insight into Man’s quest for the stars that will appeal to both space enthusiasts and a wider audience beyond.”
ANDY GREENACRE - THE TELEGRAPH
“This unique and stunning collection of images beautifully produced by Benedict is an excellent and insightful look at a fascinating subject.”
HENNY MANLEY  - ESQUIRE MAGAZINE

“Space, the Final Frontier...Benedict’s NASA images will inspire you to believe that humanity is truly capable of anything. NASA - Past and present dreams of the future” with it’s beautifully crafted photography, you can see the photographers deep respect and love for Space exploration in every image.”
THOMAS PAYNE - POPULAR SCIENCE (USA)
Five F1 engines of the Saturn V rocket. From the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
For Redgrove, it’s about showing the emotional impact of these objects. “I wanted to explore the reaction we have to these machines and objects when we see them in fine detail,” he says, “and what they mean to us as human beings.” 
“The image of the astronaut, or spaceman has been with me ever since I was child, as a sort of talisman to all that is great and good. They symbolise the explorer, the hero, the good character, the leader. The spacesuit takes on that character. The suit and the human become one entity, more powerful than either on their own. It’s now a symbol in its own right, and it has become greater than the sum of its parts. It has reached an iconic stature that few objects can match. These objects have come to signify the pinnacle of human achievements.” 
Extravehicular Mobility Unit (EMU) Suit - NASA Johnson from the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
Redgrove spent five years negotiating and trust-building with NASA followed by four years of photography and production while holding down his day job. 
It paid off, and he gained access to some of NASA’s most restricted areas and facilities allowing him to photograph objects rarely seem by the outside world. He went inside the Lunar Samples Lab to photograph the priceless moon rock collected on the Apollo missions, watched the sun set behind the International Space Station from the mission control room and entered the assembly rooms where the next generation of spacecraft are being built. 
Spread showing the Destiny Module of the ISS, from the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
Spread showing Space Shuttle Atlantis from the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
Spread showing the Vehicle Assembly Building from the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
But it was his encounter with Atlantis, the last shuttle to fly, that left him feeling the full power of these objects. “I watched the launch of the first shuttle mission in 1981, when I was 11, and that started my obsession with space and NASA. Seeing Atlantis was like meeting your childhood hero, but better. I felt like I was having a religious experience.” 
Space Shuttle Atlantis at Kennedy Visitor Centre from the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
The result is a collection of intimate, finely-detailed images that allow that objects to tell their own story. Shot using digital backs on technical cameras, some images are made up from over 60 exposures to capture incredible detail. The images are then painstakingly retouched to remove them from their backgrounds, allowing them to be viewed without distraction. 
Neil Armstrongs rubber stamp, used to identify his suit. From the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
HISTORY
I know your first memories are subjective, but as far as I can recollect, my earliest memory is being in a pram, in a dark room with the curtains pulled closed and seeing a grainy black and white picture of man walking on the moon. I was born in May 1969, so I share my years with the Apollo Lunar landings. Maybe this is why I have been so interested in all things space and space travel all of my life. 
From watching the shuttle missions and thinking how fantastic that must be to launch into the huge skies above, to hearing about skylab and imagining all that they were doing up there, and being worried when things went wrong. 
Space was the great adventure, it was the escape and it was the reality, it was all the sci-fi films I watched, but for real. They were magical, exciting and wondrous times for me. It was history before my eyes and I wanted to hold onto those moments. The craft they were in, the suits they wore meant so much to me. They were more than objects, they represented the future, all that was good and exciting with the world. 
Space Shuttle training facility. From the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
I have spent the last nine years organising and producing and five years shooting the objects and sites that represent not only my childhood, but all that is good with humanity. Exploration, the thirst for knowledge and the betterment of man kind through those qualities.  
My dreams of going into space are now relegated to acceptance of staying on this beautiful planet of ours, but the objects still hold a magical and transformative power for me. It is this energy that I wish to convey. The excitement and wonder of all of these objects is something I hope to transfer. 
I have been to various NASA sites and shot tests and specimens and displayed objects through the help of so many NASA officials from mission controllers, technicians and engineers, project leaders, space suits labs, the space station controller, the Orion facility, the Boeing Starliner facility, the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum, the incredible educational facilities that the amazing people at Space Centre Houston are creating, the launch pads, the assembly building, the neutral buoyancy labs, the robotics lab, the historical records, human space travel, Aerojet Rocketdyne systems, the hallowed vaults of the lunar vault. Inside the ISS mock up trainer, the cockpit of the shuttle trainer, held original training gloves of Gene Cernan, Dave Scott, Al Bean, the stamps that marked all of Neil Armstrong, Jim Lovell and Gener Cernan's items, the cameras that the Apollo astronauts trained with on earth, stood in the "jet pack" MMU 1 that Bruce McCandless helped develop before he took number 2 into space and floated unattached to anyone or anything, the farthest person from earth at the time, looking like the loneliest a man could be, and probably the most exciting a fun and exhilarated too.  
This has been a huge part of my life for nine years and now I am able to share it fully with you.
The images have been retouched. 
The book has been designed and laid out. 
The costs have been worked out.
Now it's your chance to be part of this enormous project and help bring it to life. With your support we can get this made, something you can proudly say, "I helped make that happen".

Space Shuttler Atlantis RS25 engines. From the forthcoming book "NASA - Past and present dreams of the future" by © Benedict Redgrove
11x14 REWARDS PRINTS
For your convenience I have listed the images that will be available for the rewards with 11x14 prints. These prints are not interchangeable and have been arranged like this so we can be accurate with our costs and timings on delivery. 
The first print tier has two 11x14 images, these are numbers 1 and 2
The second print tier has five 11x14 images, these are number 1-5
The third print tier has ten 11x14 images in it and unsurprisingly that includes all the images
11x14 print selects

WHY KICKSTARTER AND NOT A PUBLISHER
I had been offered a much easier route with a publisher, but I felt that after nine years of work, I wanted the project to conclude in way that felt honest to me. Involving another party that might want to do things their way didnt feel correct, but Kickstarter really does offer that chance. 
It connects me with you, the people who are not just buying a book,  but more importantly backing and supporting the project. Its a much closer connection than any publisher could offer and I am honoured to have your support and personal involvement, it really means much more to me this way. Your support and connection with the book gives this project more life and spreads it throughout the community through your enthusiasm and shared love of what we are doing together.

BEHIND THE SCENES

THE BOOK DETAILS
The book is 295mm (11.6inches) x 375mm (14.7inches), over 350 pages with over 200 images and weighs around 5kg (10lbs). It is printed on 200gsm GF Smith Heaven 42 with a heavy bound cover with a subtle and tasteful debossed title.

PROJECT COSTS
The project costs are broken down into print production, book production, binding, deboss, materials, design, web site, fulfilment, delivery, shipping boxes, prints, letters, stickers, kickstarter fees.

SOCIAL MEDIA AND PROJECT SITES
https://www.instagram.com/benedictredgrove/
http://www.the-nasa-project.com/
https://www.facebook.com/BenedictRedgrovePhotography/
THANK YOU FOR BEING PART OF THE PROJECT AND SUPPORTING IT
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have 20 years experience working on global advertising campaigns, both in print and film. I am used to producing work to deadlines and to the highest possible quality for internationals clients. I have made advertising campaigns both in print and on TV and online. My clients include, Audi, BMW, British Airways, IBM, HP, Virgin, Lexus, Toyota, VW, and publications such as WIRED, Wallpaper, Esquire, GQ, The Telegraph to mentions a few. 
The book has been designed, with just a few of the technical pages awaiting copy. My retouchers are some of the best in the world as are the books printers. 
The only issue that would possibly be a problem will be in proofing stage where due to the nature of the images, we may need to adjust some fo the images to make sure they are as clean and detailed as possible without whites looking dirty.
This will be the highest quality book, produced and designed by the best teams and will be delivered to you in secure custom made packaging and on time. We have estimated the production schedule backwards from the time of delivery and have built in over a month of time as a safety margins for any unforeseen issues (meteorite strikes and end of planet events have not been factored in)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Giving books and prints as gifts
updates.update_content:
Well this wasnt the year that any of us ordered. I think we can all safely say that 2020 can ...........
I wanted to take this opportunity to thank you all for supporting the project and for recommending the book and prints to others.

Can you believe it? One year ago today we were funded and the books went into production.
Since that time I have been making head roads into new projects which I will fill you all in on as and when they are confirmed.
Also I made the first set of limited edition, signed and numbered prints that are still available here, along with the last of the books.

Hi everyone.
I thought I would just drop you all a line to see how you are all doing. I hope you are all healthy and safe and happy and still enjoying your books.
I have had a few emails asking if I will be making another edition of this book. The short answer is no. This was made to a level of materials and production that is without budget levels. To make this again would require a huge investment. Plus I wanted to keep it as a limited edition of 3000 and thats the way I am making it.  So these launch edition books are the only ones that will ever be made like this and you were all part of that process. I hope I have made you proud of your investments.

I hope you all had the most wonderful restful holidays and are looking forward to a positive and exciting new year.
I just wanted to say thank you to everyone that took the time to write to me with their comments about the book. It was so lovely to hear your thoughts and obvious enthusiasm for the book, the project and about the kickstarter campaign as a whole. THANK YOU.
Im so glad it all worked out and we managed to get the books out to you in time for Christmas thanks to the hard work of everyone involved over here, they worked right up until and some over the festive period. Magnificent effort.

Its coming...
Hello everyone, thank you for all the lovely supportive comments over the past few weeks, its been really uplifting to receive them, especially when its all got a bit tough. 
So a heartfelt thank you from me to everyone thats taken the time to do that. I really appreciate it.

Hi everyone

For those of you who dont follow my instagram, Ive been signing the lead pages of the book this week and managing the print quality as all 22 tonnes of paper has been rolled through the presses here in Germany.
Its been incredible to watch, seeing the book slowly come to life. the detail in the pictures is even better than it is on screen. So very very good.

Hi everyone, im here in Germany on press. 
I dont think i can truly convey how excited I am about this and how its all looking.
The printers are incredible. We are using the latest Heidelberg LED UV presses, the machines have even had new blankets put in to increase the level of perfection. I have to say, I am truly astounded by the level of detail in the print. One of the images of the Atlantis tyre looks like you could put your finger into the tracks in the rubber.

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Emma (or as most of you know me as, Bilby) and I am an Illustrator from Scotland. I have been working professionally as an Artist for about 8 years now, and have recently began my career Illustrating Childrens Books and Running an Etsy store.  With the help of the wonderfully talented EvyBenita, I have managed to put together my first Kickstarter campaign in collaboration with her.  ♥
Together we designed Six beautiful enamel pins featuring British Wildlife decorated with Bohemian inspired patterning. I've always loved the boho style, and thought Bohemian Burrows was a rather cute name for a collection of Illustrations- The only problem was deciding what form I wanted to print the artwork in!. I recently had the idea of making this collection into Enamel Pins after seeing the beautiful colours they come in! (Rose Gold, Ahh! So pretty! ♥) 
As some of you may be able to guess, Enamel Pins are pretty expensive to have made, you need to order them in large quantities to be able to offer them at a good price, and adding things like glitter or Additional Colours also bumps up the price. I believe Kickstarter is the best way to fund these pins because of the success I have seen with other Enamel Pin projects. If I don't reach my goal nobody is out of pocket and Kickstarter makes the process easy and simple to figure out. We've surpassed the £2000 goal for the full set, and new designs have now been added! ♥
                                           The Pin Designs

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As these pins are made by a factory there could be possible delays that are out of my control, However I have made September the expected due date just to be safe in case there are any delays (They will most likely be here before then!). If the pin you want is not unlocked you will not be able to select that pin design, but you can cancel your pledge if your desired pin is not funded. 

This is my very first Kickstarter campaign and first full set of enamel pin designs I have created, but with the help of the wonderful Evy I'm sure she will keep me on track and make sure the process goes smoothly. Evy has had experience running many successful pin kickstarter campaigns, and this one I hope will be no different! <3

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone! Bilby here <3 
Last month, I launched my Patreon Pin Club, and I thought here would be the perfect place to show you guys the new pin design I did <3  They are rather similar to the Bohemian Burrows pins since every month they will have a new animal of the town of 'Bilby Burrows'. There will be a Seal, Bears, Red Panda's, Skunks and all sorts of adorable animals you can collect every month <3   Pins will be starting to get sent out in November as Octobers payment will be paused due to me having some extra book illustration work to do. I thought having the extra month would be good to get some extra members before I order the pins <3

Hey guys! I know it's been quiet but I have now received my half of the pins! 
The Badger

Hi friends, 
We just sent out your surveys! Please don't hesitate to pop us a message if you spot any issues. If not, happy choosing! :D <3
Big hugs,

Hi friends, 
We did it!! Thank you SO MUCH for making this campaign such a fun and wonderful experience. Look what we've accomplished together! Not only will the original six-piece set be made, but also four additional pins, making it a big 10-piece family of Bohemian Burrows pins :D <3

campaign.story:
Hey everyone! Jemaica here with a set of camper themed pin designs and vinyl stickers that I would be so happy to be able to produce!  :) I picked some of my personal favorite campers to incorporate into some cute nature scenes. They are close to my heart as I have lived in an RV full time, and I am a big nerd about camper conversions, alternative lifestyles and such!
They will be 2" tall, or 2" wide for the horizontal pins. I will work with my manufacturer to try and keep them as exact to the designs as possible, and keep lots of detail. However if some small bits need to be changed please be understanding :) 
Pledging early will help get all the designs funded faster, so feel free to pledge as if they were all unlocked already.  If the design you want doesn't get unlocked you can always cancel your pledge and you will not be charged, until the end of the campaign! 
If you like these designs please share this campaign with your friends and it would mean a lot! 
I will ask everyone which pins from the unlocked designs they want at the end of the kickstarter through the surveys :) 

3" Vinyl Stickers add-on! 
You can add a 3" vinyl sticker of any design by adding $3 to your pledge! Add $6 for 2 stickers, $9 for 3 stickers and so on. All sticker designs are already unlocked. I will ask what stickers you want when I send out the surveys. They will be super high quality vinyl stickers. I have had one made from the same material on my car for over a year and it lasts all kinds of crazy texas weather! Perfect to slap on your camper, laptop or water bottle! 
Shipping + Timeline 
After the kickstarter, funding takes 2 weeks to get to me and then I will order the pins! If everything goes smoothly the pins should get to me in July. Then I will place them snuggly in bubble mailers and send them off to you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have completed a number of kickstarters in the past, and everything should go smoothly. Even if there are mixups like a manufacturing error, I have added extra buffer time to the deadline just in case!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hello, my name is Pinkachii and I am back with my 2nd kickstarter!! Pinkachii is an enamel pins small business, and my previous kickstarter was a hit! This time around I hope to fund all 21 of these interactive UFO Claw Machine Enamel pin designs!
Normally I fund my own pins but for a massive project like this I am seeking the support of all my lovely followers and anyone interested in seeing these come to life! ♥
Follow us on Instagram to see more!
WHAT'S A KICKSTARTER?
Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing crowd funding platform. You will not be charged unless the project is 100% funded. Pledge now and pay later if and only the initial goal is met!
When funding is met, Kickstarter holds onto the funds for 2 weeks for processing then releases the funds to me so I can this project moving along!
You can always change your reward tier later if you want to add more on if the other pins are unlocked. But why wait? Pledge now to unlock all the other goals to ensure the pin you want is put into production!
 THE PIN DESIGNS
I've made some spinning pins before and thought it would be fun to make some sliding pins for a change! That's when claw machines came to mind.
The project has also been updated to include mini versions of the prizes inside the claw machines! Every single goal has been unlocked for a grand total of 106 pin designs!
Each claw machine design though unique will share certain features:
3" across at the widest point
Glitter and gold plated ✨
Triple posted with color matching rubber backings
Backstamped with Pinkachii logo
Will feature a sliding claw!
 The Normal Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Snorlax, Buneary, Ditto & Skitty ⭐
The Fire Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Turtonator, Arcanine, Ninetales & Rapidash 🔥
The Fighting Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Bewear, Lucario, Pancham & Meditite 👊
The Water Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Wailord, Lapras, Starmie & Marill 💦
The Flying Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Mega Pidgeot, Farfetch'd, Hoothoot & Swablu 🐦
The Grass Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Vileplume, Hoppip, Roselia & Whimsicott 🌱
The Poison Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Muk, Koffing, Nidoran & Stunky 💀
The Electric Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Electrode, Mareep, Shinx & Joltik ⚡
The Ground Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Krookodile, Cubone, Phanpy & Trapinch 🏜️

The Psychic Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Gothitelle, Espurr, Solosis & Munna 🔮
The Rock Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Golem, Pupitar, Lunatone & Rockruff ⛰️
The Ice Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Frosslass, Alolan Vulpix, Cubchoo & Spheal ❄️

The Bug Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Pinsir, Metapod, Combee & Charjabug 🐞
The Dragon Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Dragonite, Axew, Goomy & Jangmo-o 🐉
The Ghost Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Aegislash, Banette, Litwick & Mimikyu 👻
The Dark Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Tyranitar, Houndour, Murkrow & Poochyena 🌙
The Steel Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Steelix, Magnemite, Mawile & Aron ⚙️
The Fairy Type UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring Togekiss, Cleffa, Snubbull & Swirlix 💕
The Pika Smash UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring the Pika & Pichu Smashers ⚡
The Jigglypuff UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring all the Smash Jigglies 💖
The Kirby UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring the Smash Kirby Family ⭐💨
A NEW CHALLENGER ARRIVES!!!
Wow everyone! We've unlocked all 21 designs in just 2 days! So of course I have to add more stretch goals! The more we unlock the more will be added! Check out the new goals!
The Karp UFO Catcher Claw Machine featuring our favorite king of splash and his splashy family 🐟
The Clow Catcher Claw Machine featuring the best cute guardians Kero, Suppie and Momo 🐸🐱🐰
 The Totoro Catcher Claw Machine featuring Big Toto and fam 🌱
  The Eevee Catcher Claw Machine featuring baby Eevee and all of it's evolutionary family ⭐ 
GAME PRIZES!!!
Many of you have requested some of the individual pins as prizes! So here are the 81 new stretch goals that you all voted for on Instagram! Each mini prize pin will be between 1"-1.25" big! 

**Update: All 81 have been unlocked!!!

There is a tier for pledging just for the small pins now! 
**If you want to add on more to your pledge, simply add $8 to your current pledge
***Throw in an extra $1 for every 5 small pins added for shipping purposes.

COST BREAKDOWN & TIMELINE
These are how the funds will be utilized and the tentative timeline for the entire project.
Spending
 Pin Production: 70%
 Shipping & Packaging: 20%
 Kickstarter Fees: 10% (they always take 10% or so of the proceeds)
Timeline
 Early April: Campaign begins!
 End of April: Campaign ends and 14 day of processing funds
 Mid May: Receipt of funds and production begins
 Late June-July: Rewards received and shipped out!
**You will receive a survey at the end of the campaign where you can choose which pins you want as well as give shipping information.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! ♥
So far on my pin journey I've received so much love and support it's unbelievable. I never imagined I'd be able to draw for a living but here we are.
All the love and support give me the passion to keep Pinkachii going. 
Again you can keep up with us mainly on Instagram but also on Twitter and Facebook! ♥
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm a well seasoned pinmaker with 1 year of experience under my belt now and have a tight working relationship with my manufacturer.

However there are always risks which include items not shipping on time and manufacturing issues. Since I only design the pins and do not manufacture them myself, production time and quality is out of my hands.There's also the chance that designs may slightly be changed due to current manufacturing capabilities and the limitations of the medium.

However I'm confident that overall everything will go well ;)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thank you for taking the time to stop and look at my campaign! I'm Sam, sole artist and owner of Little Lunar Rabbit Designs.
Ultimately, the goal of this campaign is to get some pins made. To help make the project more manageable, the initial goal was a relatively low one - being only one pin. Rather than running the campaign for all 10 designs and risk not being able to fund everything, I had hoped that by breaking the project into smaller chunks, we would be able to produce as many as we could!
We're now a ways into the campaign, and the original campaign is beyond successfully funded! Since we do still have some time left, I have added 4 all new bonus designs, re-released the original Crystal Bunny pin, and added on some really fun milestone stretch goals! 
The pin that started it all - my crystal bunny design! Having made this one, having gone through the whole process of making my own vector art, translating the emblem into a pin, and finally getting the finished piece in hand is what sparked my desire to finish the rest of the series. It was such a wonderful experience working with the manufacturer for this design, that I am very much looking forward to working with them on the future designs!
Due to the insanely unexpected success of this campaign, this pin is now available as an add-on for $11 each, and will be available as a selection for your pledge! 
  For those of you who are familiar to Kickstarter, this is simply a little refresher. And for those of you who are checking it out for the first time, here's a breakdown for how things go!
- Pledge your reward: Choose which reward tier you'd like to "pledge," this is your own placeholder in the project funding, payment isn't due yet, so hang tight! Pledging is zero risk - you pay when the campaign ends and are free to edit your pledge at any time while the campaign is running!
- Campaign runs for 30 days, goals are met, and pins are unlocked! 
- Campaign ends, you select which pins you'd like from the unlocked designs through a project end backer survey. This is where your pledge payment is processed. 
- Kickstarter releases funds after 2 weeks, and pins are sent into production!
- Pins are mailed to me, sorted, and then mailed out to you!
 Finally on to the fun stuff - the best part, and why you're all here - the pins!!
After the campaign is over, the intent is to sell the pins at $12 each. 
As a thank you for participating in the campaign and helping me reach my goal, I've set two special price brackets for this project. The "Early Bird" pricing is a limited pricing option, available on a first come, first serve basis. The pins in those select brackets will be $10 each, and come with a free holographic vinyl sticker.
After that, the Kickstarter exclusive pricing will be $11 each.
- If you would like to pledge for more than 10 pins, all you have to do is add $11 per pin to your pledge! -
The holographic sticker will also be available as a pledge add-on, which will be discussed more in the "Extras" section - on to the pins!
Initial Goal: Tuxedo ($300)
 1.5" Wide
Hard Enamel with Gold Plating
Recessed metal accents
5 Colors
Double posted with rubber clutch (won't spin when worn!)
Back stamped with raised metal logo
Individually packaged with backing card in a clear cellophane bag
 All of the stretch goal pins will be:
 1.25" Tall
Hard Enamel with Gold Plating
5 Colors (with the exception of Neptune and Mini Moon, who have 4 colors)
Double posted with rubber clutch (won't spin when worn!)
Back stamped with raised metal logo
Individually packaged with backing card in a clear cellophane bag
Pluto, Uranus, Neptune and Mini Moon's designs feature recessed gold accents as well.
Stretch Goal #1: Mercury - UNLOCKED!

Stretch Goal #2: Mars - UNLOCKED!

Stretch Goal #3: Jupiter - UNLOCKED!

Stretch Goal #4: Venus - UNLOCKED!

Stretch Goal #5: Pluto - UNLOCKED!
 Recessed gold accents on Garnet Orb
Stretch Goal #6: Uranus - UNLOCKED!
 Recessed gold accents on Space Sword 
Stretch Goal #7: Neptune - UNLOCKED!
 Recessed gold accents on Aqua Mirror
Stretch Goal #8: Saturn - UNLOCKED
Stretch Goal #8: Mini Moon - UNLOCKED!
 Recessed gold Time Key, and Crystal Carillon accents
- BONUS DESIGNS! -
With the campaign having been so successfully funded in such a short amount of time, I've decided to add some additional bonus designs! These designs were not originally a part of the campaign, but after much request, will now be as well! Due to the fact that they were not a part of the initial campaign, designs may be subject to slight modifications after approval from the manufacturer. Any updates to these designs will be announced as needed.

 Exclusive to this project, I'm making an extra special holographic sticker! They will be weather safe, and UV coated, so you may blind your enemies with shiny moon-powered love, either inside or outside!
While Early Bird participants will be getting this sticker for free, you can also pledge for it by itself, or add it into your pin pledge! The holographic stickers will be $4 each. 
You may add as many stickers as you'd like to your pledge, just by adding 4 times the amount of stickers you'd like. For example: If you'd like one pin, but two stickers, you would add $8 to your $11 pledge. It's that easy! You will be able to specify that quantity to me when you get your backer survey.
Once this project is over, this sticker will be gone forever! 
Additional Pins - If you would like more pins than currently offered as a reward tier, you may absolutely add on any additional pins from the entire collection (including the Crystal Bunny pin!) for $11 each! When I send out the backer survey, you will be able to specify how many of which pins you'd like.
The campaign has officially hit 10k!! I am absolutely astounded by your support for this project, and as we continue to hit new milestones, I'll be announcing new free gifts! 
10K Thank You - Metallic Chrome Sticker - Free with Any Pledge!
 ((Sample image courtesy of StickerApp, sample designs by @AskSweetCream on Twitter)) 
For every pin pledged, all backers will now receive a FREE 2" tall metallic chrome sticker to match! So if you've pledged for let's say one Mercury pin, you will receive one free matching Mercury sticker! If you've pledged for the Full Collection - Bonus Edition . . . that's right! you'll receive a free sticker for all 15 pin designs! 
If you would like additional chrome stickers, you are more than welcome to add them to your pledge for $2 each! I will have a fully comprehensive backer survey at the end of the campaign to designate how many of which kinds of additional stickers you'd like, as well as your pin selection. 
100 Facebook and 100 Instagram Share Gift!
As a thank you for sharing the project for me, I'll be including a free galaxy aesthetic lanyard with every backer's pledge (please note this does not include the "Lunar Love" tier - only for those who are getting items shipped to them!)!  
They'll be 2 cm wide, galaxy print, with a matching aesthetic to the campaign imagery. You'll be able to put your pins on it without it clashing, or you'll be able to just have a space themed lanyard for whatever use you'd like! I know I'm gonna use mine for holding my con badges! They'll also feature my Little Lunar Bun on them, though the placement may change to the back of the neck.   
For those of you who do share the project, be sure to tag me (@LittleLunarRabbitDesigns on both Instagram and Facebook - if your Instgram account is set to private, be sure to take a screenshot and send it to me, otherwise I might not see it!) and be entered to win a FREE Sailor Guardian Spirit Jersey! 

15K Thank You Gift - Rainbow Plated "The Moonlight is a Messenger of Love" Enamel Keychain!
 That's right! "The Moonlight is a Messenger of Love" design is officially unlocked as a 2 inch soft enamel, rainbow plated key chain with a matching heart shaped clasp! This bonus item is free to anyone who pledges for 3 or more pins!
 - Timeline - 
So. Everything looks good, you've made your pledge, and now you're just . . . waiting. Here's the projected timeline for how everything will go: 
 April 5 : Kickstarter campaign launches. 
 May 5: Kickstarter campaign ends, and backer reward surveys are sent.
 Mid May: Funds are released, pins are sent into production
 End of June-Mid July: Pins are mailed to me and sorted. 
 Mid July-End of July: Pins are packaged for mailing!
 Early August: Estimated delivery of pins to backers!
Added into this timeline is a production buffer, should the manufacturer need additional time to complete the pins. Please keep in mind that this is a rough estimate, and while I will absolutely do my best to stick to it, these are still human made items that may require a little patience. Any delays will be very transparently addressed in a timely manner. My full time job is also that of a stay at home mom, so packaging pins may also take me some time.
And that's just about it guys! Thank you so much for stopping by, for your pledges so far, and for all the support you continue to give! If you'd like to help out in a non-financial way, I've created two images (square format and "stories" format) that you could use to share the project outside of Kickstarter! It would mean the WORLD to me if we could get to that 15K stretch goal! And if you'd like to tag me in any posts, I'm @LittleLunarRabbitDesigns on Instagram, and @LilLunarRabbit on Twitter! Thanks again! 
Square:
Stories:
 As I mentioned before, I'm Sam. An avid Sailor Moon fan (collector, fan artist and even cosplayer!), with a fantastical love of all things space themed. As a girl, I used to sit after school and get insanely hyped for Sailor Moon to come on, and then later that very night hang out on our back deck with my dad, looking up at the stars with our Polaris telescope. 
While my life didn't take me down the path of astronomy, I have always held the stars close to my heart, and try to incorporate them into as much of my life and art as possible. Crossing that with my love for Sailor Moon was an absolute no-brainer. 
My professional art journey actually started with Sailor Moon, as my first real series work ever completed. To date, I've drawn all ten scouts, Tuxedo Mask and Luna's human form, with more characters planned for the future. With each drawing, I created an emblem to pair with each portrait, which sparked one of my most successful lines to date. The pins here are variants of those very emblems, with a new twist, specific to these pin designs. 
To see more of my work, you're more than welcome to follow me on all of my social media platforms!
Facebook || Instagram || Tumblr || Twitter || Etsy
Before I wrap this up, I wanted to take a couple moments to thank those who have helped me so much throughout this project, from advice on how to start this project, to the pin production itself, all the way to annoying little design questions. I wouldn't have felt the confidence I do in running this campaign without their help.
Vivian Tong || Sketchbeetle Art - Sheila Wong || Sheila Wong Design & Illustration - Salt Squad Queen || SharkCafeArt - Mellanie Chafe || LuniaraMC
And lastly, my own personal cheer-leading squad - Daci, Toni, Kat, Kieran, and my husband. 
A little late, but a super important one that I missed - Santana. Without her final push, honestly, I wouldn't have thought this was possible. 
 The benefit about Kickstarter is that while the campaign is running, everything is risk free. You can change your mind not only about how much you pledge, but also if you want to pledge at all. While I genuinely hope you'll be here for the whole journey, I do understand if you need to back out! 
A couple of things to remember:
 Color translation varies from monitor to monitor - the final pins may be a slightly different than what is shown. I have provided my manufacturer with specific Pantone codes, and aim to have them as close to those tones as possible.
 Line weights may vary slightly from what is shown- at the end of the production process, the pins are polished in a way that very lightly flattens the metal, making the lines appear thicker than pre-polishing. While I tried to make my designs with that in mind, there may still be some variance on the final pins.
 All orders will be sent with tracking (including international!) - once the pins leave my hands and are on their way to you, they are unfortunately at the mercy of the postal service. Package exteriors may receive some damage, but I always do my best to ensure the contents remain undamaged. In the very unfortunate event that a package is lost, please reach out to your local post office for additional information and be sure to file a claim with them before reaching out to me - once that's all sorted let me know and I will try to be as accommodating as I can be!
International backers are responsible for all VAT/Customs fees involved in receiving your order
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is my first Kickstarter campaign, and only my second time taking on pins, I am very confident in my abilities to be able to fulfill whatever level of rewards we end up unlocking! I do currently run a successful Etsy shop, and customer service is very important to me. Any issues that come up will be transparently addressed, and I will do my best to resolve them in whatever capacity I can. 

I have also been working very closely with other artists who have run very successful enamel pin campaigns for advice and feedback. 

Feel free to message me with any questions!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Alright guys, the re-re-makes got here yesterday and I didn't want to post anything until I had the chance to make an executive decision about quality and sort through them all. 
I am SO happy to report that I've gotten them all sorted though, and the quality is exponentially better. That being said, I'll be polishing and packaging this batch tonight, and then sending the remaining orders out by this weekend!
Thank you so so so so so so so very much for all of your continued patience. So close to finally wrapping this up, and everyone getting their orders!

Hey again. 
SO! I was hoping to have the new pins in hand either yesterday or today, but I actually JUST got a tracking number today. It's express shipping, but I can't seem to get an "estimated delivery date" out of it yet. I'm assuming Tuesday-ish? 
Literally the second they arrive though, I'll be busting open that package, getting them sorted asap, and working on packaging the remaining pledges. Thank you so much for all of your continued patience while I get this sorted out! You've all been so freaking wonderful! <3

updates.update_userinfo: Orders 200-300 are out - updates on later orders.
updates.update_content:
. . . Are you sick of me yet? Lol.
Unless there was a hiccup, and I needed to email someone specifically, all orders between 100 and 300 are all in the mail! Now, while I've previously mentioned to you that there are roughly 355 backers for this project, the numbers actually extend to just under 400. The way Kickstarter works is that when a backer drops, it doesn't replace that number, and scoot everyone down in line, it just assigns the next backer the next number.

updates.update_userinfo: Remake Update - Order has been placed, now the waiting game starts.
updates.update_content:
Hi y'all. 
Thank you so much for all the kind and sweet words telling me not to stress about the issues with the Sailor Moon pin. I really appreciate everyone's flexibility (but I also do understand the desire to own the original color too! Hence why I wanted to fight to have the pins remade). It's also wonderfully surprising that some of you even wanted to add the additional green variant to your orders. Happy accident, I suppose?

updates.update_userinfo: Aaand, we have our first hiccup.
updates.update_content:
Hey y'all. So, I was intending to keep this under wraps (because I thought I had been able to resolve the issue in a timely manner) - but alas, it does seem as though I have encountered my first massive hiccup in the project. 
The new batch of the Sailor Moon crystal bunny pin came in with MOSTLY seconds grade pins. I was able to pull a decent number of them for the bulk of the campaign, but I very quickly ordered a second batch through another manufacturer for time's sake, instead of attempting to photograph each pin and send them to the original manufacturer. The "new" manufacturer was the one I had used for the Moonlight key chains, and I honestly didn't think there would be any issues - they had been vouched for by another artist, and I loved the work they did on the key chains, so I figured it was worth it to just go straight to them.

updates.update_userinfo: First wave of orders is being delivered - second is on its way!
updates.update_content:
Hi again! I'm so happy that the first 100 orders have officially started showing up in my Instagram and Facebook feeds! If you were between backer number 1 and 100 and you were US based, your order should have been delivered, or is incredibly close to being delivered. If you are between 101 and 201, your orders are on the way! 
My husband is being absolutely wonderful in helping me pack orders, and we should be able to get 201-300 out shortly!

updates.update_userinfo: Quick update - orders are going out!
updates.update_content:
Super speedy update. I'm really busy at the moment with con prep, packaging your guys' orders, and running my Etsy, so sorry for making this super brief! But the first of the packages are officially out! It was a small batch, but I'm gonna keep on getting them out as fast as I can. 
I'm hoping to have the first 100 out by the end of next week at the absolute latest, if not sooner. So start keeping an eye out if you're backer number is under 100! <3

updates.update_userinfo: Almost there! Please check addresses, Pin Updates, and Sticker videos!
updates.update_content:
Alrighty guys! We are almost there! I'm done sorting most of the last batch now, just finishing up the preliminary packaging for Helios' Pegasus pin, and then I have Diana's pin left to sort! I should be able to have hers done by tomorrow, and then the first batch of pins should be going out on Wednesday! 
I'll be starting in backer numerical order, with backer #1, and working my way down the list like that. So the later backers might not be seeing their pins until the middle, possibly even end of the month, depending on how quickly I can get everything boxed up and shipped out.

updates.update_userinfo: Outers and Chibiusa have been sorted!
updates.update_content:
Alrighty guys! I want to first apologize for the fact that I've had this photo literally just sitting ready to be uploaded for a couple of days now - it's been a little busy here, but I wanted to officially let you know that the next wave of pins has been 100% sorted and initially packaged! 
As I explained to a follower on my Facebook, what I'm doing is sorting one entire batch of pins at a time. So for example, Chibiusa's pins. I ended up ordering 250 pins for her alone. So I sort all 250 of her pins, then put them all on backing cards, polish them to get rid of my finger prints and shine them up, put them in their cello bags, pull your guys' rewards and put them in a separate box so I know I have them reserved, and then put away the remaining pins in their respective grades. So, so far I've sorted through 2500 pins, and I'll be sorting and packaging the remaining 1200 this week.

updates.update_userinfo: First round of pins has been sorted!
updates.update_content: Alright guys, I just wanted to share an update with you guys! I have officially sorted through and initially packaged the first 5 designs of the campaign! So here we officially have the first 5 pins!

campaign.story:
Hello! Welcome to Hobby Pets, a hard enamel pin Kickstarter project! I'm Linda, known by my online handle & brand name lemoncreamsicle, and I am a part-time illustrator & designer! I've been creating colorful merchandise (like enamel pins) since 2016, and have been creating art for much longer than that. I'm pretty active on my instagram, and will be posting smaller project updates there!
The Hobby Pets project combines my two loves - the celebration of fun hobbies with cute pets! This campaign will put that love into creating a host of colorful, cute, and relatable pin designs. If all stretch goals are unlocked, this Kickstarter will produce 8 unique designs, with 2 colorways for each design. Let's meet the contenders!
Pin specs & backer rewards
Guest Artist Stickers
Crowlines ( Instagram | Twitter )
For our final stretch goals, I've invited a guest artist - please meet Crowlines! They're a great artist with a distinctive and cute style, and I'm super glad to have them onboard.

Each pledge will include (1) 3 inch sticker design of your choice of the stickers below!
Additionally, these sticker designs will be added to the sticker selection pool, so if you've selected a stickers-only tier or have added-on stickers, you can purchase more than one design & multiple copies!
You can add-on to your pledge for extra stickers / pins! If you previously pledged to an early bird tier and would like extra pins or would like more stickers, please add to the amount that you've already pledged: 
$2 per extra sticker 
$11 for an extra single pin 
$10 * number of pins you'd like to add for multiple pins (e.g. adding 2 pins, add $20 to pledge)
For example, if you've already pledged to "Choose 4 pins," and you'd like to have your choice of 3 extra stickers, you would add $6 to your pledge without changing your rewards tier for a grand total of $46 + shipping. Now, you will get your choice of 4 pins, 3 stickers, and 1 random sticker!

Additionally, if you've chosen to add-on more stickers than the number of pins you've ordered, you can also select the design for the random sticker design!
Past pin designs I've brought to life. From sketch ideation, to digital art, and finally to negotiations with the manufacturers, I've seen these designs through the whole process. You can expect this kind of quality with this Kickstarter project!
The timeliness of this project will also be based on the backers! Please submit your surveys of which pin/sticker designs you like in a timely fashion to ensure that we get everyone's preferences accounted for.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Please note that all colors & designs are subject to change. I am currently designing the pins, and while the overall designs will represent what has been shown in the Kickstarter (I won't change the designs dramatically), the color palettes / small details may be altered to best suit the design.

Overall, I have been selling things online for a few years now, and have created several other enamel pin designs. I've looked into a few different manufacturers and have found one that I'm happy to trust with these designs.

But as always, there can be issues with manufacturing and shipping delays. I will definitely keep you up-to-date on any new issues, though the timeline has a minor buffer accounted for these cases.

Please let me know if you have any questions or feedback!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
I'm happy to inform you all that with the exception of a handful of surveys that haven't been filled, all rewards have been shipped!
If you haven't received some form of communication from me about your pledge status, shipping information, or otherwise, please don't hesitate to reach out to me via Kickstarter or email (lemons.in.cream@gmail.com) so we can get it sorted out.

Here's a quick snap of the Hobby Pets collection:

Hi everyone,
Thank you all so much for supporting this campaign! I want to thank each and every one of my backers for sharing, commenting, supporting, and above all, pledging to make this a reality. I can't wait to start production!
This is just a friendly reminder that backer surveys for all physical rewards tiers have just been sent!
Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns -- and remember, the faster everyone is at letting me know what they'd like, the faster I can order the pins & stickers and move the project along!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Due to the pins being made by a third party manufacture, there can be a risk of defective pins, which will cause a delay in shipment. I have made pins in the past and I am familiar with the pin production process. I take pride in the quality of my pins, so quality is very important to me. 

If there was an off chance of defective pins, I will work to resolve them and will keep all of my backers posted through the process.

You can check out https://www.etsy.com/shop/LunarMagicStudios if you would like to see the quality of pins!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
For this project, I decided to utilize a direct factory for my plush to help reduce the funding goal for the product. I also hired a customs broker to assist me with shipping the plush, customs paperwork and delivery of the plush to my home. 

As this is my first time with the process, I gave an ETA time of September. 
But like with any overseas project, production and shipping delays can occur. If any of these things do happen, I will be sure to communicate and post updates via Kickstarter and on my social media outlets.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: I need your help to spread CUTENESS! NEW keychain plush pouch campaign!
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday Everyone! 
Beary Boba and Corgi Macaron has gone off to a great week and are over 60% funded. Beary Boba and Corgi Macaron are working really hard to meet their funding goal so they can go on all the foodie adventures. 
I need your generous help to help share the cuteness so that these adorable pouches can become a reality. https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mochibearstudio/cuddly-cute-plush-pouches
To help provide a littler more perspective on the pouches, the honey bear helped me create little videos of both pouches.  I appreciate your amazing support, and hope to continue designing things that make you smile. -Tiffany

updates.update_userinfo: Corgi Macaron and Beary Boba Plush Pouch Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Good evening everyone! 
Tomorrow, July 14th, at 7am PST. I will be launching a very new plush pouch keychain Kickstarter featuring Corgi Macaron and the redesigned Beary Boba Plush. Feel free to preview the campaign via this link. Once the campaign goes live, the link will be updated to show the live feed of the page. updates.update_userinfo: New Foodie Buddy Enamel Pin Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Happy Monday Everyone!   
I am working on a new  Kickstarter campaign, called Foodie Buddy, because food tastes better in the company of a friend. This campaign has funded all the enamel pins and we even unlocked a freebie Sakura Mochi Bear pin for 3+ pin tiers. As of right now, we are now working on a stretch goal to unlock a Sakura Mochi Bear washi tape which will be free for ALL pin tiers! The campaign is in the last week stretch, and I would appreciate it if you can give it a looksie and sharing it with your friends.  If you click the image, you will be directed to the campaign site.

updates.update_userinfo: A Plush Kickstarter Collaboration w/ an A-Peel!
updates.update_content:
Good Morning Everyone!!
I hope everyone is doing well and enjoy their new friends! I am so excited to announce that I am collaborating with Holly of Kimchi Kawaii on a Kickstarter with the cutest a-peel ever! I am bringing in Bearnana and she has Bunana Bread. Together we shall provide you your daily dose of puntassium. 
We are already 40% funded and would appreciate if you would take a look at our campaign and share with your fellow banana and punny enthusiasts!

Good Morning Everyone!
I am FINALLY finished with everything! I finished packaging all one dozen backer reward packages that was left  this morning and just need to put on the labels and mail it out first thing Monday morning :)
Thank you SO SO SO much for everyone's patience and support through this process. I sincerely apologize for the delay for my last 12 backers. Now I know---buying a house + fulfilling a kickstarter= one hot mess. And I am so appreciative that you are all so understanding and loving through this!

updates.update_userinfo: Plush Only Tiers All Done! & Small Delay.
updates.update_content:
Hello Everybody!
All of the plush only tiers have been completely mailed off today! In order to expedite the process a bit, I didn't send you a tracking number via Kickstarter message, but if you need the number, feel free to contact me. A small batch of plush + shirt orders will be mailed out on Monday.
So life happened. As you all know, I am moving, and my official move in date was finalized for next weekend. My second box that contains the rest of the Pho shirts were accidently already packed and improperly labeled as one of the many "Tiffany's Clothes" boxes. This will cause a very slight delay to packages that include a shirt. About a dozen of backers will have their package sent by mid October at the very latest. This includes the commission tier.

Happy almost Friday!
Hello everyone,
Just a quick update---I am still shipping and I promise I have not forgotten your order. As posted during the Kickstarter campaign, your ETA for delivery is September 2018, and as it is still early September, I am still on track, YAY! If the ETA changes otherwise, I will always update you, as I do with my past campaigns.

Good Morning Everyone!
QC was a long process but it is finally completed!!
I also began shipping out packages! Do not worry if you haven't seen yours yet, because I will send out a tracking number to notify you when your package is on the way.
If you had a Custom Commission tier, your items will be shipped out last. I am awaiting for your custom acrylic charms to be shipped to me/picking out a frame that would match your commission.

The plush have arrived!!
I am SOOOO HAPPY, but now my house has so many boxes and not all of them are even pictured! 
I have started a new full time job and have to go to several day long trainings all this month, but I will be doing quality control in between.

campaign.story:
NEW ART ADDED:
      Hi! My name is Ross Tran and welcome to World of Nima! I’m a digital illustrator for the Entertainment Industry and I’ve been producing videos for my YouTube channel RossDraws for almost two years.
Nima is my original character whose story and world I've been developing for the last 4 years. Nima is a combination of all my childhood influences and inspirations and I want to inject every bit of life from the grand adventures I experienced as a kid into my own personal world.
Nima’s story takes place in a world with hauntingly beautiful and vibrant locations. I want Nima’s world to excite people the way I was drawn into the world of Avatar the Last Airbender. I draw a lot of inspiration from anime like Full Metal Alchemist, fighting games like Super Smash Bros., and movies like Spirited Away. Nima’s world will take you through an expansive and magical journey with a dynamic cast of companions, travelers, and enemies. This book will show my vision from start to finish, depicting this vivid world with scribbles, sketches, key scenes and cinematic paintings.
Every page will be crafted with care with a mixture of Typography, Layout, Graphic Design and Digital Illustrations.
  The book is the first step into introducing Nima to the world.
           SHIPPING - 
Shipping will be handled through the Pledge Manager! Please enter a 'safe' address to have the book and rewards sent to since the Development of the book can take some time. If you do change your information the time it's shipped, please leave a forwarding address with your local post office. I frequently will be updating you on the process and completion of the book, so incase you break up with your girlfriend or boyfriend, you still have time to change your address and get the book safely :)
CREDITS -
Ross Tran - Creator - Artist
Youtube
Instagram
Facebook
Brent Ashe - Logo Design and Branding Help
Instagram
Hamps - Theme song Composer
https://soundcloud.com/grynpyret
ABOUT ME:
Ross Tran moved to LA to pursue a design career at 17. By 19, he designed a character for a feature film. He's worked in the industry for the past 6 years. Some of his clients include Samsung, Riot and Disney. He now works on his own franchises and produces videos for his YouTube channel RossDraws.

Some clients include:
  Thank you so much for your support! It's my dream to bring Nima's adventure and world to life. With your help, I can take my first step on this journey and I can't wait to bring you along!
-Ross
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first book so there will be challenges in my way, but I'm highly prepared to develop my own project and bring it to life. I graduated from Art Center College of Design, known as one of the hardest working schools in existence. 

Note that there could be unexpected challenges and factors that affect the delivery date of the book such as weather, politics, and convention dates. If anything arises, you'll be the first to know. 

I'll be sure to have great communication with publishing, printing, shipping and you, my supporters, to make sure things go smoothly. I'm based in the US so less risk is involved through distribution. I can't wait for you to see the book!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

comments.content: So I've seen that the website is up but I'm not sure where to enter the code?

I never did receive my $45 dollar pledge for the Nima book. I was wondering if we would be able to get this sorted as it's been quite a while since the initial Kickstarter launch. Thank you very much!
http://www.nimaverse.com/
Where can I get the digital copy of the book?
I paid for it and can't find it.
When will nimaverse work?
Looking to get my digital reward and can't find anything... Please help!
Hi! I didn't receive my book yet... How can I see if there was a problem or something? Please contact me if you need...
Any update on the nimaverse site?
I was thinking the same thing. I checked the website and nothing was there.
Backing a kickstarter is a leap of faith. I will not be taking that leap with rossdraws again.
Big thanks to Mindy for tirelessly helping with a few questions & adjustments even up until recently! I hope we'll see more projects from Ross in the future too (￣▽￣)ノ

If the contents are exactly the same, why couldn't you have given the Kickstarter pledgers the special edition rather than the normal? You promised the Kickstarter pledgers the slipcase (essentially a special cover) as stretch reward, we met it, then revoked it, only to be told you have to actually buy another book for the new cover. Don't mean the sound mean, but I love your art and personality, but the business side and way you treat backers really, really needs some work.

I apologize if the negativity seemed unwarrented. The art and content Ross and the Nima team is truly stunning - I appreciate it so much. It just seems like there are a bunch of pieces not adding up and not making sense to me, leaving me in a somewhat uncertain and unhappy place concerning this project.
Looking forward to whats next in the Nima-verse.

campaign.story:
UPDATE: A lot of backers have been asking about the actual gameplay planned and for those who have not yet read the excellent graphic novels here is a bit of insight into the characters and story.
Story
The main character, Dinah, is a 15-year old girl who lives in a rundown New England town called Bizenghast. Although the town is rife with supernatural activity, no one else believes Dinah's claims that ghosts are coming and going through the crumbling buildings and dilapidated streets. Only Dinah's best friend, Vincent, believes her...though he's never seen any ghosts himself.
That all changes when a late walk through the surrounding woods lands them both on the doorstep of an otherworldly guild called the Mausoleum, located in a cemetery that seemingly comes and goes at will, and all managed more or less efficiently (if very, very strangely) by the afterlife. Accidentally committing to a job contract as a “human agent,” Dinah unknowingly agrees to return every night to this supernatural waystation, where the lost souls of humans are stored and rehabilitated until they can pass on to the other side. Dinah must enter into vaults which contain the strange and surreal dreams of these ghosts and try to solve the problems that hold them back from moving on. Or, you know, die trying.
Each vault is a separate level in the game, which Dinah has to enter, navigate and solve, a task far easier said than done. The ghosts are often unaware that they're even dead in the first place and so it's up to Dinah, and you as the player, to discover the meaning of their death and then figure out how to help that spirit pass on.
Luckily, Dinah has a little otherworldly guidance while she's on missions, in the form of a very bizarre guild worker named Edaniel, who is a green, and is a sort of...well, in ten years, we haven't figured out what he is exactly, but maybe you can. Long-eared cat? Long-tailed bunny? Some kind of pointy monster? At any rate, he's got a fine taste in hats and terrible taste in everything else.
Abilities and Allies
Vincent - Vincent is Dinah's childhood friend and lives in the town of Bizenghast with her. A young man whose wealthy parents are always traveling and leaving him more or less alone, he sticks with Dinah through everything, considering her his only true friend. Even though he has no contract with the Mausoleum, Vincent nevertheless volunteers to accompany Dinah every night, giving her moral support and a helping hand whenever he can. Per the rules of the Mausoleum, he can't enter the dream vaults with Dinah, but he can stay outside in the main building and assist her in other ways!
Edaniel – Although he's often more scatterbrained and silly than helpful, Edaniel gladly escorts Dinah through the ghostly vaults and volunteers to wear a tinfoil hat, to help boost the signal of Vincent's cellphone and cut out some of the supernatural static. In addition to this, there are hidden bonus hats for the player to collect throughout the game, that each receive their own bonus audio content when Edaniel puts them on. Everything from radio plays, to afterlife broadcast announcements, to Edaniel's internal thoughts, and even a special director's commentary for the game itself! Collect all the hats and get hours and hours of bonus game content!
Dinah using her ghost vision.
Ghost vision – What everyone else assumed was a bad case of the crazies in Dinah actually turns out to be a kind of heightened intuition. When Dinah is near ghosts, or items that have been used by them, she gains a special, ghostly sight that allows her to pick up clues in her environment, perceiving the actions of the spirits around her and providing insight on where to explore next.
Vincent develops some ghostly images.
Vincent sets up a makeshift HQ and photo lab in a side room of the Mausoleum, and helps Dinah out in a number of ways:
Cell phone: Vincent has a cell that he uses to keep in contact with Dinah, although reception is spotty, due to the supernatural interference. Luckily, Edaniel wears a tin foil hat to help boost the signal, but his calls can still come in through a lot of static and may be difficult to understand at times.
Dinah calls Vincent for help.
Knowledge: Vincent is an amateur historian and knows a ton about the town and surrounding areas. This, along with his moving of vital history books into his makeshift lab, means he can provide clues to each ghost's personal history and may be able to help Dinah along if she gets stuck.
Camera: Occasionally, strange silhouettes appear, darting in and out of the ghost worlds. No one is sure what they are, but they point to a bigger intrigue within the Mausoleum itself. Dinah uses a disposable camera to take pictures of these creatures (since the spirits only appear on regular film) and brings them back to Vincent, who develops them in his lab and tries to piece together what's really going on.
Map: As Dinah explores each new ghost world, she describes it to Vincent, who draws a map and helps her keep track of where she's been, where certain landmarks and items are, and he can make backtracking and retracing steps much easier.
Gameplay: When you play as Dinah in the ghost vaults you will enter a world that has been created by the ghosts imagination. The laws of physics often do not hold true and nothing is ever as it seems. Here, players will have to explore the environment, looking for clues and unlocking puzzles to discover the mystery for each ghost as to why they are tormented and cannot pass on. The reasons behind each ghosts burdened soul are unique and it is up to the player to discover the cause of each spirits death. Were they murdered? Does the spirit want revenge? How do you convince them to let go without killing their murderer? How do you help one seek closure for accidently killing their true love by unknowingly infecting them with the black plague? How do you bring justice to the kidnapped children of a crazed witch? What do you do about a young privileged girl who was accidently murdered by two of her friends? These are only a few examples of the difficult choices you will face.
