Our Game Engine partners - Unreal Engine 4 from Epic Games
"We have always been huge fans of the Unreal Engine from Epic Games. When we heard the announcement at GDC about the pricing change we jumped at the chance to switch our pipeline over to have access to such an amazing toolset." Ziad Seirafi Cosmic Forces, CEO
"a delightfully dark, gothic manga called Bizenghast."
--Pocket Gamer
Ten years after its start, Bizenghast is back... as a possible video game. 
--Anime News Network
M. Alice LeGrow’s manga Bizenghast, one of the flagship original English manga for Tokyopop, was touted by Teen Vogue as a must-read; it spawned a tabletop game, a line of merchandise, an art book and a legion of obsessive fans.
--Crunchyroll
Let’s Kickstart that Bizenghast video game--Technology Tell
Cosmic Forces is partnering with author M. Alice LeGrow and TOKYOPOP to bring you an immersive RPG game, set in the strange and eerie world of Bizenghast, an acclaimed graphic novel series celebrating its tenth anniversary.
With its unique art style, strong female protagonist and dark humor, Bizenghast has garnered fans worldwide and been published in over a dozen languages.  Now the adventure continues within the dark ambiance of the Bizenghast video game.
This fully-3D adventure puzzle game will be created by some of the most talented designers and animators in the industry.  The Bizenghast game team is made up of Cosmic Forces' award-winning artists, who have won multiple Oscars and Emmys for their work in conjunction with Sony Pictures Imageworks, Sony Animation, Nick Jr. and other companies.  Their animation experience, as seen in blockbuster films like “Oz the Great and Powerful”, “Hotel Transylvania”, “Tim Burton's Alice in Wonderland”, “Olivia” and more, brings incredible expertise and a captivating style to this project.
In addition, M. Alice LeGrow, the writer and artist of Bizenghast, will be working on the creative team, producing concept art, character designs and other aspects that will make this game spiritually faithful to the graphic novel series -- and she will be the voice of Dinah, the main character!
With all-new characters, adventures and story, the game will be highly accessible to new fans, while still fascinating to those already familiar with the book series.
The Bizenghast video game will be a third-person role-playing adventure. Gameplay will feature story-driven action, puzzle solving and haunting ambient exploration. Players will experience a rich narrative with an emotionally charged story, in a dark and stylized setting. 3D immersive graphics and innovative game play will seamlessly weave detailed cinematics with intuitive controls. Become an agent of the Mausoleum, enter the world of the deceased and confront their nightmares to help them escape oblivion! 
The main focus of the project will be on blending cinematic action with intuitive game-play, merging the two effortlessly for a richer environment experience and a more personally engaging story. Emphasis will be on puzzle-solving and exploration, giving players more time and freedom to unravel mysteries and become part of the story. 
Quick Specs:
Film quality cinematics and character animation. 
Deep story-driven narrative with rich character development. 
Challenging puzzles and mysteries. 
Fully voiced characters with motion-capture animated facial expressions. 
AAA graphics and animation.
Release Platforms: Mac, PC, Linux, iOS, Android.
Chapter 1 – First 3 to 5 levels totaling 10 to 20 hours of gameplay.
Stretch Goals for additional features, characters and chapters.
Thanks to new cutting-edge technology from Mixamo, we will bring feature-film quality animation with fully voiced characters and facial expressions to the game.
Cosmic Forces is happy to partner with Mixamo! We have chosen Mixamo All Access as part of our development pipeline for this project.
Much like the movies we have worked on in the past, we plan to use a combination of motion-capture from live actors, further refined through artist created animation.

Utilizing Face Plus from Mixamo, we will also be able to support full facial motion capture of our actors.

Team Captains
 Ziad Seirafi
Cosmic Forces, CEO Creative Director
Ziad founded Cosmic Forces in 2012 after working with Sony Imageworks (SPI). Ziad is a 23-year veteran of the film industry, beginning his career in 1991 and later working television shows like "Star Trek: Voyager" and on feature films for Sony’s Mandaly Entertainment and Columbia Pictures. As a Digital Artist, he has been a member of the Oscar-winning team for "The Golden Compass" and Oscar-nominated teams for "Alice in Wonderland", "Pirates of the Caribbean: At Worlds End" and "Poseidon." In his spare time, he enjoys being awesome.
M. Alice LeGrow
Bizenghast Author, Illustrator 
M. Alice has been a professional comics artist since 2004 and is now celebrating the ten-year anniversary of Bizenghast, an eight-volume graphic novel series published by TOKYOPOP Inc, which has been published in over a dozen languages and sold worldwide.  In addition to the Bizenghast initial series, she has begun a new graphic novel series called The Elephant Book.  M. Alice has a BFA in Sequential Art and has had a love of comics since high school, when she decided she would pursue a career as a comic artist and abandoned her previous decision to be a pearl farmer in Tahiti, which was really for the best, otherwise this might have ended up being an even weirder Kickstarter.
Shawn Clark
Director of Animation
Shawn is a former Senior Character Animator at Sony Pictures Imageworks. He has over 15 years experience working as an Animation Director, Character Animator.  Originally a traditional animator and personally mentored by Disney’s golden age animator Milt Neil, Shawn made the transition to CG Animation in 2003.  His history of work has encompassed commercials, TV shows, games, and feature films.  His film credits include “Oz: The Great and Powerful”, “Hotel Transylvania” and “Tim Burton's Alice in Wonderland.”
Brett Shapiro
Creative Director, Game Designer
Brett Shapiro has over 20 years of professional experience and has worked in nearly every crew position on a wide rage of projects from Feature Films and Television to Animation, Visual Effects and Games. He has worked with ILM, EA, PDI/Dreamworks, Sony, and Apple, to name a few. Brett has been involved in research and development for digital technology pipelines through which his work contributed to productions such as Star Wars – Episode I and Lord of the Rings. Brett has designed and directed several mobile apps and he even spent 6 years teaching High School Digital Media Arts classes, where he created the curriculum for courses in Animation and Game Design. Brett has been an avid gamer for many years. He is excited to bring his strong background in both technical and creative to the medium of games.
Cosmic Forces is Licensing Bizenghast from TOKYOPOP.
Founded in 1997 by filmmaker and entrepreneur Stu Levy, TOKYOPOP established the market for manga in North America. Over its history, TOKYOPOP has published over 3,000 books, distributed anime and Asian films on home video and television, licensed merchandise to consumer goods companies, created graphic novels of major brands and led the way digitally in social media, e-commerce and user-generated content. TOKYOPOP’s brand expanded internationally with offices in Europe and Japan and a network of over 160 partners in more than 50 countries and 30 languages.  
Bizenghast (c) M. Alice LeGrow and TOKYOPOP Inc. All rights reserved.
A game about ghosts and mystery that plays out in an emotionally tense pace and stars a strong female protagonist isn’t exactly the kind of project that a large studio would fund. But like the many people who have seen and supported this project's plans and concepts, we know the gaming community will be thrilled to enter a rich world with a deep narrative that includes interesting and well-defined characters.
So we are here on Kickstarter to seek your involvement. In addition to simply backing the project, we want to involve you in the entire game-making process, giving a behind-the-scenes look at how this game is made. For anyone who backs the project at $25 or more, you will not only be given access to our closed developer forums, behind-the-scenes videos and the opportunity to be present for live video conferences, you will also have access to our development journal and we have some exciting plans to involve our backers in some of the key decision making that will craft the game.
While $125,000 will allow us to bring you an amazing and fully featured first chapter of the game, we have a lot more planned. With your help, we can reach for our stretch goals, so we can better realize our full vision and give you the best game possible!
$150K: Unlock Dinah's best friend Vincent as a fully-3D, voiced companion character, as well as his parent's mansion and his private house to explore!  
$200K: Team travels to Prague to record the entire musical score for the game with a live orchestra!
$250K: Unlock the entire town of Bizenghast!  NPCs to interact with, houses and shops to explore, mysteries and secrets to unravel!
$300: The two tower brothers, Edrear and Edaniel, are unlocked in human form as fully voiced and animated NPCs, as well as access to bonus secret rooms inside the mausoleum!
$500K: The second chapter of the story is unlocked, with more cinematic plot, more ghost vaults, more achievements and secrets!
$700K:  The third chapter of the story is unlocked, revealing all the ghostly vaults, achievements, hidden map areas and secret items of the game!
$1,000,000: The entire game is created from start to finish with all the extras, bells and whistles we can cram in, and ending with a glorious, heart-pounding, fully-cinematic finale!
The Game, Mobile Edition– Chapter #1 of the Bizenghast game for iOS or Android.
The Game, Computer Edition - Chapter #1 of the Bizenghast game for Mac, PC or Linux.
Digital wallpapers – Special Edition wallpaper art for your electronic device.
Forum Access - You will receive exclusive access to our private developer forums, where we will be posting frequent updates on the game's progress and sharing a behind-the-scenes look on every aspect of the game's production. This will also include video blogs and live discussions with key team members!
EARLY BIRD SPECIAL! If you are one of our first 100 backers, you will receive digital edition of the Bizenghast graphic novel, book 1, as an eBook from Comixology! 
Soundtrack – Digital copy of the haunting game soundtrack!
Art Book (Digital) – Digital version of the Special Edition Art Book. This will include concept art, paintings, storyboards, character sheets and everything else from the production of the game that we can possibly include!
In-Game Outfit for Dinah – Kickstarter backer exclusive! We will craft a special in-game outfit that will only be available to our backers. Backers will also be selected to vote on its final design!
Beta Access - We need beta testers for the early beta versions of game builds!  Your playthroughs and feedback will help us test and improve the game before its release. We will have a dedicated private forum for beta testers, where you can post comments and suggestions to help us shape the game design.
T-Shirt – Nothing says “I'm on the development team” like an exclusive shirt!  Special Limited Edition Bizenghast video game t-Shirts will be designed only for backers and our in-house development team, and will not be sold anywhere.
Playing Cards – A full deck of beautiful Bizenghast playing cards, featuring all-new artwork by creator M. Alice LeGrow.
8.5”x11” Poster – A limited-edition full color Bizenghast game poster. 
Bizenghast Graphic Novel Series – Explore the Bizenghast story with the complete 8 book graphic novel series published by TOKYOPOP.
Bizenghast Art Book, Falling into Fear - Art book with 24 mini-posters and 12 pages of stickers featuring limited-edition art from the graphic novel. 
Name on a Grave – Your name immortalized in stone, literally! You can put your name, your pet's name or the name of a friend or family member on a gravestone that will appear in-game, in the Bizenghast graveyard for all players to see for eternity!
Great Big Poster – Cover your wall with the Limited Edition 36”x40” full size wall poster signed by artist M. Alice LeGrow, Creative Director Brett Shapiro and the creative team.  If you wall isn't big enough, build a new wall. It'll be worth it.
In-game Painting – Artist Creator M. Alice LeGrow will create a digital painting of you, or a friend or family member of your choosing. The painting will appear in-game, in a frame, on a wall, for all game players to see. You will also receive a 36"x40" physical print of the painting, signed by M. Alice LeGrow, sutiable for framing!
2 Tickets to Launch Party – You and a guest will be invited to our launch premiere party, where you can meet the entire team, our friends and family, and schmooze with entertainment industry guests.  (Note: M. Alice will try to challenge you to a spring roll eating contest.  Don't accept, because you can't win. No one ever does.)
Statue of You – A 3D model stone statue of your likeness, or that of a friend or family member of your choosing, to appear in the game, in the Bizenghast graveyard for all to see.
In-Game Character – We will create an NPC of you, or that of a friend or family member of your choosing, that will appear in the game. Your in-game likeness will appear somewhere creepy and players will be able to interact with you!
Dinner and Stay in Santa Fe, NM – A 2-night stay at a premiere resort hotel in Santa Fe, New Mexico. You will get to hang with members of the creative team, meet creator M. Alice LeGrow and Creative Director Brett Shapiro and be treated to a high class dinner with key members of the development team. The spring roll warning still applies.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
$125,000 is the absolute bare minimum we need, in order to create the first chapter of the game and do it justice, without sacrificing our vision or the level of quality to which we are accustomed.  Coming from a background in high-end studio feature films, we know quality and have the creative and technical expertise to deliver great visuals.  With the funding we receive, we will also hire experienced designers and professionals from the gaming industry, to help us develop and build the actual game-play, run operations smoothly and deliver a really well-made, entertaining game.
 
A big consideration, even in multi-million dollar games and media production, is time.  While our goal is to have a delivery date of Winter 2014, there are always unforeseen issues that might crop up.  We plan to be totally transparent with our backers as we go about our day-to-day work on this project, providing ongoing development journals and updates for everyone to stay involved, every single step of the way.  Our main focus is to deliver the highest quality experience possible to our backers, because without them, this project wouldn't be possible!

Hello wonderful backers! We want to thank you for your continued support and inspiring comments. It’s great to see that there are so many other people out there who feel as passionate about bringing the world of Bizenghast to life as we do. With less than 2 days left we need all your energy. Our goal might seem far off but every little bit helps. So get out there and show us how much you love Bizenghast. Every little bit makes a difference, even just $1, so grab your friends and get them to kick in.

Hi everyone, we wanted to give a shout out to another great game here on Kickstarter. Go take a look at The Red Solstice.
As a fan of co-op, strategy and RPG games, I think this game looks pretty awesome!
-Brett

Hey there!
Marty here, chilling with a sandwich, a drink and two grumpy cats trying to occupy my lap at the same time. Sounds like the perfect moment to talk to backers about some of the more involved game play and story lines we've got planned for the Bizenghast video game!
Although many of you are familiar with the story of Bizenghast from the graphic novels, some might be new to the series. Or maybe, as a fan of the original series, you're wondering just what will stay the same from the books and what might be different in the game itself. So read on for a little refresher on the original story and find out what has been updated to make the game play unique:

updates.update_userinfo: Feast your eyes on some awesome concept art!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
M. Alice here on a fine, fluffy Thursday, enjoying a rare moment when the sky isn't barfing down three feet of snow on Philadelphia. I am so over winter. Spring is the new winter and everybody better get on that style train.
Anyhow, in this update I wanted to share with you some of the most AMAZING fan-created costumes from Bizenghast! BZG's been around for ten years now, and it's had a lot of incredible cosplayers use their talents to bring the Bizenghast cast to life...there's just too many to even include here! Seriously, your devotion and craft just blows me away every time. All the different interpretations of the characters just shows how awesomely diverse and creative the fan base for Bizenghast really is.

Hello backers!
We are at the half way point and as I know that all of you who have backed the project thus far are as passionate about seeing Bizenghast in game form as I am, we are still a long way off. Fear not! We still have 15 days left and a lot can happen.
We recently announced our support form Epic Games who will be helping get the word out. Along with this is our official announcement that we are switching to the new Unreal Engine 4 for development. What does this mean? It means that we are planning to create the Bizenghast game with the latest and greatest tools. I’ve been working tirelessly the past week to learn the new game engine and convert our assets over.

Cosmic Forces is excited to have a new Game Engine partner Unreal Engine 4 by Epic Games. 
Thank you to Unreal for promoting Bizenghast and Cosmic Forces indie game studio. Please check out the updated Kickstarter video to see the new game footage created in UE4. Keep in mind this is pre-alpha game footage. There is so much more that we want to do, and for that, Bizenghast requires your backing. Thanks!

I first discovered Bizenghast the year after the first volume was published, in a bit of promo material at SDCC. I fell in love immediately with the art and story, but the thing that stood out to me was the fantastic main character, Dinah. She, like me, struggles with mental and physical health problems. It was truly incredible for me, as a struggling preteen, to have representation in Dinah, to see her struggle with many of the issues I dealt with daily, but also see that she could overcome her issues and still go on such fantastic adventures. Bizenghast means a lot to me, I'm so thrilled I can help back this latest installation.
So excited to be backing this project! Can't believe everything that you get at each level. I was excited before, but then when I found everything that comes with it I donated more!!

My first encounter with Bizenghast was in middle school, when a friend was showing me the fascinating cover art in a bookstore. I didn't read it 'till years later, and I regret that wasted time ever since! Please please PLEASE help make this game a reality-let's not waste any more time to help create something awesome!

HOKAY, HERE'S MY BIG ZEN HATS STORY: Back in 2002-2003, when I was first starting high school, I was surfing around deviantART and found the art of a very popular user called sadwonderland. That user was Marty LeGrow before she was published. At the time, she was shopping BZN around for interested publishers. I *LOVED* the artwork and happily watched her pitch turn into a published series. I remember when it was originally slated to be only 3 books, then become 6, and finally turn into 8 volumes! I own all of them and still vigorously recommend and loan them to friends. I've played a full campaign in the roleplaying game and created an entire city, numerous characters and the world's dankest bar just for it. Now that I am 26, having left high school, college and my hometown behind, Marty's art and writing continues to amaze me today, I still watch her on deviantART, and I return to the series over and over for inspiration and good old fashioned black humor. And I promise you this: I will never, EVER stop quoting Edaniel's rant on Cracker Jack prizes.

I fell in love with Bizenghast from the very first volume. I've bought every ashcan that Marty has produced on her Etsy and own all the volumes, plus that one novel I think someone else actually wrote. I am so excited for this video game to happen.
Bizenghast: better than a crate full of kittens and Tastycake snacks.
Dinah is MEGA RELATABLE for every kid growing up who feels like they don't fit in. It's AWESOME watching her grow from scared little girl to brave young woman and it's INSPIRING
I've been reading Bizenghast since the first volume came out - I can't wait to see it realized as a video game! It will be awesome to see the Masoleum, Dinah, and the new ghost worlds in 3D.

I read Bizenghast back in middle school at my library, and loved it so much that by the time I was in high school I had bought all the volumes out. When I found out Tokyopop wouldn't be publishing the last book I was crushed, I had to know how it ended, it was only one more book! I found out Marty was going to publish it herself and waited anxiously for the final book to be released, and bought it the second it came out. I've continued to follow Marty on deviantart for years, I've bought all the ashcan comics she released and her newest project The Elephant Book as well (I'm excited to see where that goes too), and I've even commissioned her for some custom artwork which now hangs in my room :) I lost my mind when I saw this was on kickstarter, this was something I had wanted for years! I not only posted it to my facebook page, but I even messaged my old friends who I remembered had also loved Bizenghast (people I hadn't spoken to in years) just to tell them about this. If I had more money right now, I'd donate so much more then I did, and if I manage to get more spare cash this is definitely where it's going! :)
http://cakesfromwonderland.blogspot.co.uk/2014/03/passion-and-bizenghast-rpg.html
Really looking forward to the game, and I'm hoping it can make enough money to be made.

Bizenghast has been one of my favorite series for a long time, and I am so excited, not only to see it continue, but to see it continue specifically as a video game. I really hope this gets fully funded, and I'm glad to be able to contribute to the campaign.

I can't express my love for Bizenghast enough. There aren't enough words in the English language to fully articulate my love for this series. The story has captured my interest, and the characters have captured my heart. It belongs as a video game. This needs to happen.

I would love to see the world of Bizenghast become a video game!! Such opportunity for a really fun and beautiful game. I'm a fan of the comic and M. Alice's other work and am hoping this game becomes a reality!

I love this series, I love it so much! Bizenghast was the very first sorta horror anything I'd ever gotten into. I was first drawn in by the beautiful and deliciously creepy art Marty posted on DA and when I found out there was a whole graphic novel series featuring this wonderful, creepy, very cerebral and not out and out gore and horror art I knew I had to have it! Bizenghast is how I know I love creepy things while still not really enjoying traditional horror, it's why I gave Night Vale a chance and looked into the SCP website and I gotta tell you: I'm loving every minute of it! I already pledged $15 because I definitely want a copy of the game, even if I have to buy a new computer to be able to play it. I am planning to up it on my next pay check though, $15 doesn't seem fair for buying a full game! If I keep pledging and this game ends up not being made I will be heart broken, heart broken I tell you!

I was in high school when I first started reading Bizenghast and totally fell deeply deeply in love with the artwork and its characters. The fact that its now being made into a video game is like a dream come true. This is kind of like when tokyopop went out of business and I couldn't get the last book FOREVER and then magically it appeared on the internet. I'm super happy to support Marty in her quest and her magical ways.

Oh this had SO better get funded! It will be like a dream come true! An especially AWESOME dream come true! I've loved Bizenghast ever since I randomly came across it in a bookstore in like... 11th grade? Yeah it was 11th grade. Wait that doesn't seem that long ago. WELL ANYWAY. I was looking through the manga section with my friend and she was the one to find Bizenghast. She told me that the back said something about collecting lost souls and that it sounded like something I would be into. I looked at it for a while and finally decided that I would give it a try. BEST DECISION EVER. The ultra super amazing artwork is what drew me in and I stayed for the ultra super amazing story.

I came extraordinarily late to the party, and from an unusual angle. I got hooked on a certain party princess thread on Something Awful when it gained a measure of viral momentum; being happy to support people who seem awesome I took a punt on The Elephant Book knowing nothing about it — of course I loved it; with Bizenghast firmly on the radar my fate was sealed when it started appearing in Comixology's new releases.

I love this series. It's almost impossible to get hold of in Malta, so I consider myself lucky to have read even 6 of the books. Bizenghast is what got me into manga, comics, cosplay and even writing comics. I wanted to emulate the story's mix of humour and creepiness, and slowly discovered my own style. I now write for Courier Collective, a local group that produces an anthology (Pilot Comic Anthology) annually. Basically, I have a lot to thank Bizenghast for. I may not be much of a gamer, but I'm happy to support Bizenghast and M Alice LeGrow in any way I can.

I nearly read the whole thing in store before a) realizing I should just buy it and b) my parents were looking for me. FERRETS TO THE MOOOOOOOOON.

campaign.story:
The Circuit Scribe Kickstarter is over, but you can order Circuit Scribe at Electroninks.com!
Follow us on:           Facebook    |    Twitter    |    Electroninks.com
Circuit Scribe: Draw Circuits Instantly
Circuit Scribe is for Makers, STEM Educators, Artists, Kids, & Life Hackers. We wanted to make it easier for Makers to Make.  
No shaking, no squeezing, no goop, no smell, no waiting for ink to dry. Circuit Scribe draws smooth lines with conductive silver ink and allows you to create functioning circuits instantly. 
Invent Instantly
Circuit Scribe is for Makers of all ages and skill sets.
STEM Education: Circuit Scribe was made for project based learning.  Kids can build circuits and switches in their notebooks and use those concepts to get creative!
Low-Cost High Quality Electronics: You can build a circuit with nothing but a coin battery, paper clip, and LED, or build out complex circuits with multiple components. 
Flexible Electronics: Draw your circuits, cut them out, and stuff them into your inventions - instant robot guts. 
Goodbye Breadboard: Breadboards add a level of abstraction and annoyance to circuit building.  With Circuit Scribe you can draw exactly what you want, no wires or breadboard required.
Open-Source Hardware: You can use Circuit Scribe with Arduino, Makey Makey, and many other electronic platforms.
We wanted to make creating with Circuit Scribe even easier for our KICKSTARTER backers, so we developed a series of electronic components just for you!  These components will snap directly onto the page as long as you have something magnetic behind them, such as a refrigerator door, small piece of steel, magnet, etc.  The components depicted are prototypes, the design of the final components may be a little different. 
With Circuit Scribe schematic sketches can become instant working prototypes. Our custom electronic components snap right in to your circuits.
We’re really excited to see what you come up with! We've been working on Circuit Scribe for a few years now, and we can't wait to take it from prototype to product!
Right now we brew small batches of ink and fill each pen by hand.  We need KICKSTARTER’s help to scale up our ink production and fill our first order of pens. We want Circuit Scribe to be affordable, so we need to manufacture them at a large scale.  We've found a USA manufacturer who will work with us to produce batches of pens, but we need your help to make it happen!  We've put together some Kits for our backers that make it easy to learn & build with Circuit Scribe. The components depicted are prototypes and will evolve as we hear your feedback and develop the final designs.  We can't wait to see what you make!   
Thank You for helping us reach our goal!  We can't wait to get Circuit Scribe out to our Backers!!
Stretch Goals: 
$250,000 - Circuit Scribe Edu Platform & STEM Outreach
GOAL REACHED! Now we can make the robust, user-friendly, online education portal of our dreams! We are hard at work building a platform for kids, educators, & makers with activities, lesson plans, and user-submitted projects. 
$650,000 - Magnetic Sheet for Kit Activity Books & Maker Notebooks
GOAL REACHED! A Magnetic Sheet will now be added to Activity Books and Maker Notebooks that come as part of the Classroom Kit, Maker Kit, Developer Kits, & Basic Kit + Book Rewards Levels.  If you'd like to get an additional Magnetic Sheet as part of your Reward, just add $5 to your pledge! 
You can place the light-weight magnetic sheet under any sheet of paper and snap your components into your drawings! Check it out: 
$1,000,000 - Resistor Pen
If we hit $1M we can produce a Resistor Pen. The pen will let you draw resistors into your Circuit Scribe circuit sketches. See it in action:
KICKSTARTER BACKER REWARDS:
Give Circuit Scribe as a gift! 
Do you want to give Circuit Scribe or a Kit to a teacher, school, kid, or friend? You can print out this Gift Certificate so they have something to unwrap!  Just fill in the Pledge Level to let them know what you got them.  Unfortunately we cannot ship to multiple addresses, so we'll ship the reward to you and you can deliver the gift in person.
Download Gift Certificate Here!
Having Fun With Makey Makey!
Circuit Scribe Inventor Analisa Russo & Makey Makey Co-Inventor Eric Rosenbaum making some beats with their inventions:
The Story Behind Circuit Scribe
Electroninks Incorporated is a spin-off company from the research lab of Professor Jennifer Lewis located in the Research Park at the University of Illinois.  We’re all about creating low-cost, high-quality electronics. We wanted to get electronics into people's hands and thought that using things as ubiquitous as pen and paper was just the way to do it. So we've developed a non-toxic, water-based, conductive silver ink for use in rollerball pens.  Back in 2011 we published a paper in Advanced Materials: 
Pen-on-Paper Flexible Electronics Analisa Russo , Bok Yeop Ahn , Jacob J. Adams , Eric B. Duoss , Jennifer T. Bernhard , and Jennifer A. Lewis.
Press Coverage
Our conductive ink was named Invention of the Month by Popular Science!
And a video of our brewing process was featured in Chemical and Engineering News: 
Prototype Process
We got a ton of emails asking if we could make the pen available commercially. So we started tinkering and sending out prototype pens to Makers.  The feedback was great! Check out what Jay Edry made with the prototype:
Technical Details
Circuit Scribe
We've done quite a bit of development work in order to make the pen you see in the videos.  The prototype pens are Sakura Gelly Roll Metallic pens.  We clean the pens by hand and refill them with the conductive silver ink.  The ink has to be precisely tuned so that it flows just the right amount of ink in order to create a conductive circuit - otherwise it spreads into the paper too quickly or doesn't flow smoothly out of the pen.   
The final design of the basic Circuit Scribe pen will look similar to the prototype displayed here and in the video.  We plan to purchase the parts directly from Sakura or partner with them outright to manufacture the pens.  The quality of the pen and the reasonable price make this the ideal choice for our ink. The rollerball pen design works really well, is cost effective, and we love the utilitarian simplicity of it.  It also writes for a while (60-80 meters).  The written lines achieve a conductivity of 50-100 milliohms per square per mil.  
Components: 
The final components will look very similar to the prototype components in the video & photos.  We're working with a USA based manufacturer to produce these components and get them to you on time!
 The LED component contains two different-colored LEDs, if you flip the component to change the direction of the current, the other LED will light up: 
 You can add your own resistors, capacitors, LEDs, and many other components to our 2 PIN board:
What would you build with Circuit Scribe?  Let us know on Facebook!
Contact Brett on LinkedIn
Contact Analisa on LinkedIn
CONTRIBUTORS:
 Michael Bell: Electroninks Consultant, is a PhD student working on 3D Printing of Electronics in the Lewis Research Group and is designing and developing the electronic components for the Circuit Scribe with Analisa. Michael is also in charge of manufacturing components. His background is in computer and mechanical engineering, with extensive experience manufacturing electromechanical devices.
Steve Shewchuk: Electroninks Incorporated Intern and UIUC MatSE Undergrad
SPECIAL THANKS:
Bok Yeop Ahn: Ink developer and post-doc in the Lewis Research Group. Bok created an early version of the colloidal silver ink now used in Circuit Scribe and has been a long-time mentor for our rollerball pen research.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with many Kickstarter projects, we face several key risks and challenges by pursuing production of this pen. Primary risks include:

ENGINEERING

In order for the pen to work very easily for the end-user, we have spent a considerable amount of time designing and optimizing the ink to work reliably in the rollerball pen. As we work with a manufacturer to take Circuit Scribe from prototype to product, we will need to ensure that the functionality and reliability of the pen are never compromised. 

LOGISTICS

This is perhaps the largest challenge of them all. Right now we produce the ink and load the pens on our lab, which means we have direct control over the quality of our product and our production timetables. In order to produce a large run of pens, several manufacturers must work in tandem to make this project a reality, which introduces many variables, potential complications and potential timeline setbacks. We will work directly with contract manufacturers to produce and optimize the ink, we will also work with pen manufacturers to produce and package the pens after the ink has been produced, and finally, we will work with the pen manufacturer to make sure the pens achieve the quality necessary for a finished consumer product that will write easily and reliably while producing conductive traces that dry quickly at room temperature. We already have a working relationship with the contacts listed to speed to development and manufacturing process to ensure timely delivery to our backers. Delivering a high quality product to our KICKSTARTER Backers is our number one priority.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Y'all,
We made some new friends last year over at Papier Machine and they've just launched a new project in Kickstarter we're very excited about and thought you may be curious as well.

Hey Backers!
You may already know we have a new campaign, but did you know we want your feedback on it? From shaping the modules to kit contents, you let us know your thoughts during the first campaign and we listened. We want to hear from you again!
Whether you back the DIY Kits or not, you were the first supports of our idea and we are forever fans of yours for that; we want your feedback on the new kits! So pop over, take a gander, leave a question or an idea; we'll be applauding in the office when you do ;)

Hey Backer Fam! 
Did you know we launched a brand new Kickstarter campaign yesterday? It's been an exciting time developing these kits in the background and an even more exciting 24 hours launching the new campaign!

Hey Backers! 
Can't get enough circuits or DIY electronics? Need a new way to get your Circuit Scribe fix? Miss playing with your Legos? Check out our friends at Crazy Circuits and their new Kickstarter Project to remedy any or all of those problems! We're excited to be a part of one of the monthly projects that teach STEM/STEAM principles; no breadboards, no alligator clips, just interactive learning with a roundup of great names from the maker community.

campaign.story:
My Fantastic Family
Hi! If you missed the campaign, please head over to thoughtmoment.com, where many of our rewards will continue to be available. There's also a description below.
Three years ago my husband and I adopted a five year old African American boy out of the LA County foster care system. "Baby Daddy" is  an evening of stand up comedy that recounts our harrowing, circuitous journey to fatherhood in excruciating detail: How my husband and I learned about the foster adopt  system (A stint on a Rosie O'Donnell "R" Family Cruise) attending parenting classes in Los Angeles (mostly gay and lesbian prospective parents learning about baby proofing all our fountains and pools) and the ultimate game changer: meeting our son for the very first time and taking him home. Intercut with scenes from our home life and backstage footage, "Baby Daddy" goes beyond the standard stand up comedy special and documents the creation of our unconventional trio, and how ultimately love defines a family. 
"Baby Daddy" was performed live in Los Angeles and New York City and won the prestigious Bistro award and was nominated for a GLAAD  and United Solo award for best off Broadway solo show.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk in filming a stand up special is whether or not it will look right. Sound right. Does the filmed version capture the experience of having attended an actual performance? Unhappily, these are all risks I've encountered before. 

There's also a chance of possible delays in post-production. We are doing everything possible to bring this in on time for you.

I've assembled an A-list group of technical talent. From my director of photography Ian McGlocklin to my director Andrea James I've put together a creative team of people who are experts in their field. This is a trouble shooting group capable of handling any technical glitches should they arise. Your funding will help me pay this team, who in turn will deliver a documentary that looks and sounds terrific. 

The other challenge is finding our audience. Again,your funding will help me produce a network quality special that hopefully finds its home and audience on the internet. I've been able to build a loyal fan base and a successful career by creating previous standup shows and portraying memorable characters. I have performed this specific show live for about a year and believe it's ready to be made into a special. I can't wait to share the final product with you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I hope to create a glorious album, but I lack the funds needed. I am working with incredible artists for music videos, demoing with talented peers of mine, and working my butt off to put out amazing art. I want more than just an album. But I need the help of those who support me! I am currently a student at Berklee College of Music, which is a very expensive school. Therefore....I am broke. But my art is just as important and my music education! 
Hence the creation of this "kickstarter" project. I have over come a lot of personal tragedies, I want to thank all those I inspired and I want to keep inspiring, with my music. I need your help!
*All rewards include a free signed polaroid picture of yours truly!
demos http://caitlinmichele.bandcamp.com/track/jesus-and-saviors-demo
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am trying to prove to the world that I am more than a singer on a reality TV show. I am an artist. I write music from my heart. I hope the world likes what I have to say. The only issue I can foresee is not making any funds for this project. I need money to pay my friends who are helping me record, I need it to pay for CDs to be put out, I need it to pay the talented musicians who are going to help me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey guys, long time no talk. A few announcements for you all♥ I am working on a new music project, recording a new EP. If you are waiting on my album, I am going to be sending you BOTH albums (the new one for free of course). There were unforeseen issues, and I am terribly sorry! But you will be receiving both this summer :)
You can find me from now on at facebook.com/caitlinfordmusic

Sorry for the delay, but they are currently being made right now. I will ship them out by mid February! If you can, please email me your address. I have to personally ship them all out. If I don't get your address, I will email you personally at a later date to attain that info.
Other prizes (ie. artwork and photos)
Those will also be mailed out at a similar time. So basically, anyone expecting something in the mail, please email me your address. If you don't and if I can't get a hold of you, there is no way I can send you anything.
